meanings.definition: Approach and address (someone) boldly or aggressively.
meanings.sent1: The stranger accosted me on the street, demanding money.
meanings.sent2: I felt uncomfortable when the man accosted me at the bus stop.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel accosted the bird feeder, determined to get some seeds.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds accosted the peaceful sky, bringing thunder and lightning.
meanings.sent5: The detective accosted the suspect with tough questions, trying to solve the case.

meanings.definition: To approach and speak to (someone) in an aggressive or unwanted way.
meanings.sent1: She didn't appreciate being accosted by a pushy salesperson at the mall.
meanings.sent2: The reporter accosted the celebrity for a quick interview outside the event.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat accosted the sleeping dog, looking for some playtime.
meanings.sent4: The waves accosted the shore, eroding the sand with each crash.
meanings.sent5: The persistent beggar accosted passersby for spare change, hoping for generosity.
